intro: Quinsonia coccinea, commonly known as the red quinsonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in spring. Its flowers are clustered in cylindrical inflorescences and are highly attractive to pollinators such as birds and insects. Quinsonia coccinea is well adapted to Mediterranean climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
